Detailed Description

A mapping tree to store properties (keys / values).

Definition at line 91 of file propmap.hpp.

PropMap::diff_map isis::util::PropMap::getDifference ( const PropMap &  second  )  const

Get a difference map of this and the given PropMap.

Creates a map out of the Name of differencing properties and their difference, which is a std::pair<PropertyValue,PropertyValue>.

  • If a Property is empty in this but set in second, it will be added with the first PropertyValue emtpy and the second PropertyValue taken from second
  • If a Property is set in this but empty in second, it will be added with the first PropertyValue taken from this and the second PropertyValue empty
  • If a Property is set in both, but not equal, it will be added with the first PropertyValue taken from this and the second PropertyValue taken from second
  • If a Property is set in both and equal, it wont be added
  • If a Property is empty in both, it wont be added
    Parameters:
    second the "other" PropMap to compare with
    Returns:
    a map of property keys and value-pairs

template<typename T>
T isis::util::PropMap::getProperty ( const key_type &  key  )  const [inline]

Request a property via the given key in the given type.

If the requested type is not equal to type the property is stored with, an automatic conversion is done. If the property is not set yet T() is returned.

std::ostream & isis::util::PropMap::print ( std::ostream &  out,
bool  label = false 
) const

"Print" the PropMap.

Will send the name and the result of PropertyValue->toString(label) to the given ostream. Is equivalent to common streaming operation but has the option to print the type of the printed properties.

Parameters:
out the output stream to use
label print the type of the property (see Type::toString())

Definition at line 176 of file propmap.cpp.

bool isis::util::PropMap::rename ( key_type  oldname,
key_type  newname 
)

Rename a given property/branch.

This is implemented as copy+delete and can also be used between branches.

  • if the target exist a warning will be send, but it will still be overwritten
  • if the source does not exist a warning will be send and nothing is done
    Returns:
    true if renaming/moving was successful

Definition at line 455 of file propmap.cpp.

template<typename T>
PropertyValue& isis::util::PropMap::setProperty ( const key_type &  key,
const T &  val 
) [inline]

Set the given property to a given value/type.

The needed flag (if set) will be kept. If the property is already set to a value of another type an error is send to Runtime an nothing will be set.

Definition at line 247 of file propmap.hpp.

void isis::util::PropMap::toCommonUnique ( PropMap &  common,
std::set< key_type > &  uniques,
bool  init 
) const

Get common and unique properties from the map.

For every entry of the map this checks if it is common/unique and removes/adds it accordingly. This is done by:

  • generating a difference (using diff) between the current common and the map
  • the resulting diff_map contains all newly unique properties (properties which has been in common, but are not euqual in the map)
  • these newly diffent properties are removed from common and added to unique.
  • if init is true uniques is cleared and common is replaced by a copy of the map (shall be done at first step/map)
    Parameters:
    common reference of the common-map
    uniques reference of the unique-map
    init if initialisation shall be done instead of normal seperation

Definition at line 472 of file propmap.cpp.

template<typename DST>
bool isis::util::PropMap::transform ( key_type  from,
key_type  to,
bool  delSource = true 
) [inline]

Transform an existing property into another (statically typed version).

Converts the value of the given property into the requested type and stores it with the given new key. A compile-time check is done to test if the requested type is available.

Parameters:
from the key of the property to be transformed
to the key for the new property
delSource if the original property shall be deleted after the tramsformation was done
Returns:
true if the transformation was done

Definition at line 233 of file propmap.hpp.

key_type  to,
int  dstId,
bool  delSource = true 
)

Transform an existing property into another.

Converts the value of the given property into the requested type and stores it with the given new key.

Parameters:
from the key of the property to be transformed
to the key for the new property
dstId the type-id of the new property value
delSource if the original property shall be deleted after the tramsformation was done
Returns:
true if the transformation was done
